channel.title: Quests
channel.description:
Don't come on here being a jackass and say "We don't spoon feed, use the search bar or google." I HAVE. So if you don't want to help, gtfo now.
Anyways, I'm having problems with my quest interfaces. I'm trying to get 'The Spells of the Gods' quest to work (If any of you out there have it as well...Probobly. I've had it on a few sources I've tried.) But when I go to the quest menu it does not show quests....Now...I know how to change what it says...But when I click on any of the quests I put there....It does not open the menu/interface. The interface was previously set up on my source but it will not open....Any help please?

item.title: Quests
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Would help if anyone else posted…Lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Quests
item.dc:creator: @waffle1 waffle`
item.description:
@waffle1 wrote:

Hmm, It never changed for me either :|. I never found out why, maybe its the q3 stage and shit. I’m not entirely sure, I’ll try to find a fix. Or if anyone else wants to post in and help lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Quests
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

I changed what makes it say uh…What it says in my client.java…But it did not change…Here’s the code:

public void loadquestinterface() {
    sendQuest("@red@WhiteKnightScape", 640);
    sendQuest("@whi@Info", 663);
    sendQuest("", 682);

    /* Free Quests*/
    if (q1stage == -1) {
        sendQuest("@gre@Invisible Armour", 7332);
    }

    if (q3stage == -1) {
        sendQuest("@gre@Spells Of The Gods", 7334);
    }

    if (q4stage == -1) {
        sendQuest("@gre@The Story Of Ramen", 7336);
    }

    sendQuest("", 7383);
    sendQuest("          - Setsuna", 7339);
    sendQuest("", 7338);
    sendQuest("", 7340);
    sendQuest("", 7346);
    sendQuest("", 7341);
    sendQuest("", 7342);
    sendQuest("", 7337);
    sendQuest("", 7343);
    sendQuest("", 7335);
    sendQuest("", 7344);
    sendQuest("", 7345);
    sendQuest("", 7347);
    sendQuest("", 7348);

    /* Members Quests*/
    sendQuest("", 12772);
    // unknown id
    sendQuest("", 7352);
    sendQuest("", 12129);
    sendQuest("", 8438);
    sendQuest("", 12852);
    sendQuest("", 7354);
    sendQuest("", 7355);
    sendQuest("", 7356);
    sendQuest("", 8679);
    sendQuest("", 7459);

    sendQuest("", 14169);

    sendQuest("", 7360);

    sendQuest("", 13577);

    sendQuest("", 7361);

    sendQuest("", 7363);

    sendQuest("", 11858);

    sendQuest("", 9927);
    sendQuest("", 7349);
    sendQuest("", 7350);
    sendQuest("", 7351);
    sendQuest("", 13356);

    /* END OF ALL QUESTS*/

It used to say “Welcome to whiteknightscape blah blah blah” Before I changed it to that, but in game it still says all of that…

Read full topic

item.title: Quests
item.dc:creator: @waffle1 waffle`
item.description:
@waffle1 wrote:

I always had trouble with that to, its a pain in the ass to find those things. You just have to keep searching its in one of the files somewhere lol.

It’s most likely in client.java or texthandler. But you said it isn’t, hmm, maybe I’ll dig up an old source from my PC and look around. See if I can find anything, I’ll keep you updated if I do.

Read full topic

item.title: Quests
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Well, mine has summoning and all that and works fine and all…The quest is perfectly set up and everything…All the people you have to talk to talk and tell you what do do…When you do certain things such as drop an item somewhere it spawns something else…I just cannot get the quest’s menu to open up OR change what the quest tab says. It is not in my texthandler class either…

Read full topic

item.title: Quests
item.dc:creator: @waffle1 waffle`
item.description:
@waffle1 wrote:

I’m sorry to inform you that I’m not really experianced with quests :(. I posted a clean/blank source from the old days. (PhoneScape or something like that…) It has working summoning and like 1-3 working quests.

I’ll try and find the thread for you, maybe you can get examples from there.

Read full topic
